title: UN Security Council Expansion: India, Brazil, Germany Gain Seats
introText: The United Nations has approved historic Security Council reform, adding India, Brazil, and Germany as permanent members. The expansion addresses long-standing complaints about the body's outdated composition.

content.content: The UN General Assembly voted 178-12 to amend the Charter, adding three new permanent Security Council seats. India, Brazil, and Germany join the US, UK, France, Russia, and China.
New members receive a modified veto power requiring at least one other permanent member to concur. This compromise addressed concerns about expanding unilateral blocking ability.
African nations secured commitment for a future permanent African seat within five years. Continental leadership will determine which nation fills the position.
